You have an Android 10 or higher:
this means, the legacy way to access your Public Storage directory is obsolete and may not work anymore even with this permission granted.

Workarounds:

  • You can use the termsh shell tool to access it via the Storage Access Framework.
  • You still can access any files located in your application\'s shared directory (and no permissions are required to do it) (see the SHARED_DATA_DIR environment variable).
